author: Aditi R
text:
To increase enrolment of children in its schools this year, the Greater Chennai Corporation has stepped up its door-to-door campaign.

“In the last few years, enrolment at Chennai schools has increased. We have been doing our best to ensure that we enrol every child of school-going age,” said an official at the Corporation.

According to the figures for the academic year 2015-16, 84,573 students were enrolled in Corporation schools, about 3,000 more than the previous year. About enrolment at Chennai schools, C. Muniappan, Principal of Chennai Boys Higher Secondary School in Nungambakkam, said the situation had improved considerably in the last few years. He said they had also been holding regular interactions with parents of children waiting to join schools. The parents are briefed about facilities available in the school. “The main focus is on girl students. We have regular counselling sessions for them. We ensure that they do not leave school midway due to family pressures,” another official said. There is also an effort to enhance the quality of education. Novel initiatives, like the Pudumai Palli project, supported by British Council, trained 22 teachers from 70 senior secondary Corporation schools in English.
title: Corporation takes steps to improve enrolment in schools
